intro: Diholcos decalvans, commonly known as the naked-stemmed holly, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and small, elliptical leaves. It produces clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and mountainous regions.
